com.camerontec.util.logger.hpl

Class AbstractHighPerformanceAppender

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.logger.hpl.AbstractHighPerformanceAppender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IHighPerformanceLogEventListener<HighPerformanceLogEvent>, IHighPerformanceLoggerAppender
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HighPerformanceAsynchronousAppender, HighPerformanceSynchronousAppender

    public abstract class AbstractHighPerformanceAppender
extends Object
implements IHighPerformanceLoggerAppender
    Base class for high performance appender implementations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractHighPerformanceAppender

        protected AbstractHighPerformanceAppender(HighPerformanceLoggerConfiguration configuration,
                                          IHighPerformanceLoggerWriter writer,
                                          ILogger internalLogger)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        configuration - The high performance logging configuration.
        writer - The writer to which serialized log events are delegated. It is assumed the writer is already open.
        internalLogger - The logger used to log internal messages. We assume this does not log to the main logging subsystem so it is safe to use even during shutdown.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If any parameter is null.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public final void start()
                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: IHighPerformanceLoggerAppender
        Start the appender.

        This is an optional operation and subclasses only need implement if required.

        Specified by:
        start in interface IHighPerformanceLoggerAppender
        Throws:
        IOException - When the appender file cannot locate or create the log file.

      • start

        public final void start(CyclicBarrier barrier)
                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: IHighPerformanceLoggerAppender
        Start the appender, awaiting on the specified barrier first.

        This is an optional operation and subclasses only need implement if required.

        Specified by:
        start in interface IHighPerformanceLoggerAppender
        Parameters:
        barrier - The barrier on which to await.
        Throws:
        IOException - When the appender file cannot locate or create the log file.

      • stop

        public final void stop()
                throws InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: IHighPerformanceLoggerAppender
        Stop the appender.

        This is an optional operation any subclasses only need implement if required. However, subclasses must guarantee that all pending logs are flushed to the log file before shutting down.

        Specified by:
        stop in interface IHighPerformanceLoggerAppender
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - When interrupted while awaiting for a shutdown.

      • doStop

        protected abstract void doStop()
        Subclass specific stop method.

      • clean

        public final void clean()
                 throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: IHighPerformanceLoggerAppender
        Optional operation. Attempt to reset internal resource usage to their default levels.

        Depending on the implementation this can be a disruptive operation and is designed to be used only in periods of relative inactivity in long running applications.

        Whether or not additional logging events are accepted during this operation is implementation dependent.

        This operation is likely to generate garbage. The caller should consider forcing a garbage collection on completion to have some control over when it is collected.

        Specified by:
        clean in interface IHighPerformanceLoggerAppender
        Throws:
        IOException - When the appender file cannot locate or create the log file.

      • doClean

        protected abstract void doClean()
        Subclass specific clean method.
